predicate.note: Frames file for 'eat' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 39.1, no other framed members. No comparison.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: TW's pitch was that sales and earnings at its restaurants have risen steadily and that people won't stop *trace* eating during a downturn.

example.name: transitive
example.text: Euro Disneyland shares made a debut like Snow White yesterday while most of the London stock market looked like it had eaten the Evil Queen's poisoned apple.

example.name: only in transitive?
example.text: Some analysts argued that there won't be a flurry of takeovers because the industry's continuing capacity-expansion program is eating up available cash.

example.name: nominal meal
example.text: ``Cheerios and Honey Nut Cheerios have eaten away sales normally going to Kellogg's corn-based lines simply because they are made of oats,'' says Merrill Lynch food analyst William Maguire.
example.arg: sales normally going to Kellogg's corn-based lines
simply because they are made of oats

example.name: prepositional meal
example.text: Personal-computer makers will continue *trace* to eat away at the business of more traditional computer firms.
example.arg: the business of more traditional computer firms
